009
010package imagingbook.common.image.matching;
011import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
012import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
013
014/**
015 * <p>
016 * Instances of this class perform "chamfer" matching on binary images.
017 * The "search" image I (to be searched for matches of the "reference" image R) is
018 * initially associated with the {@link ChamferMatcher}.
019 * The assumption is, that the search image I is fixed and the {@link ChamferMatcher}
020 * tries to match multiple reference images R.
021 * All images are considered binary, with non-zero values taken as foreground
022 * pixels.
023 * See Sec. 23.2.3 (Alg. 23.3) of [1] for additional details.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>,
027 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
028 * </p>
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2021/11/26
032 * @version 2022/09/16 revised
033 */
034public class ChamferMatcher {
035        
036        private final int MI, NI;               // dimensions of the search image
037        private final float[][] D;              // distance transform of I
038        private int MR, NR;                             // dimensions of the reference image (temp.)
039        
040        /**
041         * Constructor using the default distance norm (L2).
042         * @param I the "search" image (to be searched for matches of the "reference" image)
043         */
044        public ChamferMatcher(ByteProcessor I) {
045                this(I, DistanceNorm.L2);
046        }
047        
048        /**
049         * Constructor using the specified distance norm.
050         * @param I the reference image (to be matched to)
051         * @param norm the distance norm
052         */
053        public ChamferMatcher(ByteProcessor I, DistanceNorm norm) {
054                this.MI = I.getWidth();
055                this.NI = I.getHeight();
056                this.D = (new DistanceTransform(I, norm)).getDistanceMap();
057        }
058        
059        /**
060         * Matches the specified reference image R to the (fixed) search image I.
061         * @param R some binary reference image
062         * @return a 2D array Q[r][s] of match scores
063         */
064        public float[][] getMatch(ByteProcessor R) {
065                this.MR = R.getWidth();
066                this.NR = R.getHeight();
067//              final int[][] Ra = R.getIntArray();
068                float[][] Q = new float[MI - MR + 1][NI - NR + 1];
069                for (int r = 0; r <= MI - MR; r++) {
070                        for (int s = 0; s <= NI - NR; s++) {
071                                Q[r][s] = getMatchScore(R, r, s);
072                        }       
073                }       
074                return Q;
075        }
076        
077        private float getMatchScore(ByteProcessor R, int r, int s) {
078                float q = 0.0f;
079                for (int i = 0; i < MR; i++) {
080                        for (int j = 0; j < NR; j++) {
081                                if (R.get(i, j) != 0) { // foreground pixel in reference image
082                                        q = q + D[r + i][s + j];
083                                }
084                        }
085                }
086                return q;
087        }       
088
089        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
090        private float getMatchScore(int[][] R, int r, int s) {
091                float q = 0.0f;
092                for (int i = 0; i < R.length; i++) {
093                        for (int j = 0; j < R[i].length; j++) {
094                                if (R[i][j] > 0) {      // foreground pixel in reference image
095                                        q = q + D[r + i][s + j];
096                                }
097                        }
098                }
099                return q;
100        }       
101        
102        /**
103         * Matches the specified point set to the (fixed) search image I.
104         * The points represent the foreground pixels of a virtual reference image (R)
105         * with the specified width and height.
106         * 
107         * @param points a set of foreground points
108         * @param width the width of the virtual reference image
109         * @param height the height of the virtual reference image
110         * @return a 2D array Q[r][s] of match scores of size width x height
111         */
112        public float[][] getMatch(PntInt[] points, int width, int height) {
113                float[][] Q = new float[width][height];
114                for (int r = 0; r <= width; r++) {
115                        for (int s = 0; s <= height; s++) {
116                                float q = getMatchValue(points, r, s);
117                                Q[r][s] = q;
118                        }       
119                }       
120                return Q;
121        }
122        
123        private float getMatchValue(PntInt[] points, int r, int s) {
124                float q = 0.0f;
125                for (PntInt p : points) {
126                        final int u = r + p.x;
127                        final int v = s + p.y;
128                        if (0 <= u && u < MI && 0 <= v && v < NI) {
129                                q = q + D[u][v];
130                        }
131                }
132                return q;
133        }
134
135}
